This game is frustrating slow and tedious and layered with bugs. There is a certain level of polish in Half Life that just isn't here. It's a 1 hour game disguised as a 3 hour one simply because of things that are easy to miss or not pick up on trapping you in segments. It feels more like a poor fan made half life mod than an actual official release.

Blue Shift não é tão boa quando Opposing Force, mas tem sua importância. As mecânicas são muito parecidas com Half Life 1, o que é uma coisa excelente e a história tem sua relevância para o universo HL. O protagonista é personagem importante de Half Life 2 e acompanhar a história alternativa da sua fuga realmente acrescenta bastante a quem gosta do universo da franquia. É uma boa expansão.

Pros:
- Good for nostalgia and if you just want to have it in your collection
- Makes you appreciate how far games have come
- It was short

Cons:
- The platforming and overall physics
- The loud music pop-ins
- Bugs related to respawning, mouse control, and some character interactions

If you're just now getting into the Half-life series, you can skip this one. I've been working my way down the library and decided to replay this after many years and I wonder if I got as frustrated then as I was playing it now. Some games don't age well and this is one of them unfortunately.

gg

Not as great as the original and opposing force, but still good. I just don't feel like it adds much to the original game like opposing force did, making it an extension of Half Life rather than an expansion.

Blue Shift doesn't know what it wants to be. On one hand, it requires knowledge of the Half-Life campaign. On the other hand, the way you play it seems like it was made for beginners. 

Considering everything about it, I think that, if you've never played Half-Life before, you should play Blue Shift first to figure out if Half-Life is for you. It's a far shorter campaign that will let you make up your mind on this matter. If you've already played Half-Life, just get Opposing Force and skip this one.

Half Life Blue Shift, a simulator of what its like to see Gordon Freeman jump past you at light speeds.

Jokes aside, Blue Shift lets you play Calhoen. Calhoun? I dont even know myself. A security officer at the Black Mesa complex.
Enjoy watching the scientists to make sure they dont do anything stupid now, or in this case, try and escape from an alien invasion with the help of the guy who helped with creating teleportation devices.

Unlike Opposing Forces, Blue Shift does NOT add any new weapons to toy around with. On top of that, since you are just a meager security guard, you need to look out for vests and helmets as armour, HEV Charging Stations being out of the question.

Its a short play (it took me 2 hours to complete, can be even less) worth a play if being a supercharged killing scientist is not your flavour.
Это стоило того.

Even after all these years this is still a great little game to revisit. Barely feels significant compared to the epic nature of Half Life, but is a nice spin off that gives another perspective to the Black Mesa incident.

Half-Life: Blue Shift jest drugim dodatkiem do Half-Life z 1998r. Został zrobiony przez Gearbox, tak samo jak Opposing Force. Tym razem wcielamy się w jednego z niebieskich ochroniarzy placówki Black Mesa, zwanego B.Calhoun (tak, ten sam Calhoun co w dwójce). W przeciwieństwie do OP, ten dodatek jest jednak bardzo krótki i nie wprowadza prawie nic nowego.
+Tak samo jak w podstawce, wciągający gameplay
+Poziomy są nawet nawet, choć gorsze niż w podstawce, zagadki są na pewno trudniejsze, choć wynika to raczej z kiepskiej i nieoczywistej konstrukcji poziomów
+Nowe, całkiem klimatyczne utwory dźwiękowe, lepsze od tych z OP, choć gorsze od podstawki
+Bardziej zróżnicowany wygląd naukowców 
+-Nowa fabuła średnia, zbyt prosta - [spoiler]idziemy do ziomeczka, wykonujemy dla n iego questy, uciekamy z placówki i koniec[/spoiler]
-Żadnych nowych broni i przeciwników - wszystko wzięte z podstawki (nawet intefejs jest dokładnie taki jak w jedynce, tylko że niebieski :p)
-Strasznie krótka(przeszedłem w 2,5h)
-Takie samo jak w jedynce i OP irytujące przesuwanie przedmiotów xd
Первая четверть.

Good enough, could've been better but still was fun-ish. GoldSRC games break with raw mouse input which makes me shit myself whenever I gotta disable it. Play it if you want, don't if you're looking for more than 2 - 3 hours of gameplay.

Pretty Fun! just beat Opposing Force not that long ago. Coolest thing about all the DLC is that You can occasionally see Gordon during his Adventure through out Black Mesa. In my opinion Blue Shift was not as good as Opposing Force but i feel like that's because of the length, it took me 6 hours to beat Opposing, but only 3 for Blue Shift. also the ending wrapped up to fast, (Spoiler for a 19 year old game coming up) all you do is just simply leave black mesa nothing special no cool final boss nothing so yeah the ending was kinda underwhelming tbh. But besides that its pretty fun!

Não é tão bom quanto Oposing Force, mas é uma boa adição para a franquia.

Nele você vê como Barney e alguns outros membros da equipe de cientistas escaparam de Black Mesa.

A expansão é curta e traz alguns modelos melhorados para algumas armas. Lado negativo é que a movimentação nessa expansão não está boa, o mesmo vale na hora de interagir com objetos (meio bugado).

Tem alguns probleminhas, mas dá para relevar caso tu goste da franquia e não se incomoda em jogar games antigos.

Uma boa adição a meu ver. Recomendo em promoção.

this is a great half life game which is overshadowed by the other add on games like opposing force. I love this game but it has a really short story and i am starting to replay it now, another thing i love is that you can see the main character of blue-shift
(calhoun) who is now a standalone character and appears in other games such as black mesa and you can actually see him in hl1 which i like. to top this gmae off its a great game with an amazing story with great characters but is sadly overshadowed. 10/10

Half-Life: Blue Shift is another spin-off of the original Half-Life game. It takes place during the original game, but it ends a little before the end of it. It was developed by Gearbox (not Valve, as Opposing Force), and it came out in 2001. You play as Barney Calhoun, one of Gordon's friends that you can also find in Half-Life 2.

Once again, I won't write a full review. But it's worth mentioning that I've found it a little more enjoyable than Opposing Force thanks to the more varied gameplay (in my opinion, obviously) and the less playtime required to complete it.

Would recommend to every player who enjoyed the original Half-Life and want to explore more of the original storyline. I'd give the game an 9/10. Have fun!
the action is great, the story is good, its short but very fun. i recommend it 100%

Another expansion, another perspective: now as a Black Mesa security guard. It has more of a puzzle focus this time, adding yet another side to the original Half-Life story. It's shorter than Opposing Force made by the same team (who are nowadays well known for the Borderlands series), and a bit more grounded, and I enjoyed it not despite but because of that.

So, this game sucks. The HD models look bad. There's nothing new. Hell, it even lowers the amount of enemies and weapons in Half-Life 1. There's only a few maps. The ending isn't good. There are no bosses. Your weapon fires somehow when you load your last save after you die. There's no multiplayer. Holy fuck, this game is bad.

I know a lot of people hated this game, but I say it's pretty good. I understand it isn't as ambitious as Opposing force or half-life 1, but it has plenty of charm and it was cool getting to see more of black mesa. seeing the facility had a pizza place in a cafeteria made me chuckle. A lot of people say this game is unfair or too hard, but i beat it on a harder difficulty then i did half-life 1, and found this game much easier. really fun little game.

三部曲都通了。1代三部曲都是一周目。没有重玩的欲望。主要是老游戏，当年技术限制很多如今的游戏元素在当时是无法体现的。主体就是解密+射击。其实游玩感受比较单调。没什么丰富的玩法撑起内核。优点不可否认，物理引擎现在也是很多游戏无法比拟的，但我正好不喜欢这个引擎。它恰好模拟在假与真之间，你说它模拟了物理环境，但又没有完全拟真到现实环境的程度。很难受。
缺点么，就是单调。玩法单一，过一遍剧情，通关再玩体验和之前一样。而且所有的脚本触发都是固定的。背板可以速通。没有随机性。

Blue Shift distills the very best of the original Half-Life into a greatest hits like 3-4 hour campaign. It’s hard to imagine someone new to the series in 2020 but if you haven’t played Half-Life before I’d start here: you’ll know in a hurry if this the right game for you.

Don't listen to what anyone says. Don't skip this game. Not only is it some nice little extra content, it also helps to build the world we already seen in Half-Life and Opposing Force. It may be the weakest content in the franchise, but even the weakest is very good, so don't skip it because it isn't Opposing Force 2.
Overall: 8/10.

This second expansion of Classic Half-Life, like Opposing Force, I had never played back in the day, but have just played through both recently. (can't really review this without making comparisons between the two)  Blue Shift has good quality level design, polished and plays much smoother than the all too often unbalanced OF.  However as many reviews of the game state, BS is very short, easily completed on Hard Mode first try in less than 3 hours, forgettable ending, no new enemies or weapons.  Honestly I may play through OF again to see if I get a different impression but BS is just a much better quality experience.  I love games (classic ones for sure) that are difficult, which is the main issue with BS (it is not), while striving to do something new OF was just unbalanced and awkward, left to either run by enemies/exploit bad AI or tediously battle through with the tiny bits of ammo on the extremely inconsistently balanced weapons.  What Blue Shift lacks, OF's attempts to cover that feel like a constant fumble.  Whereas Blue Shift didn't introduce anything new and was very short, it still plays much better than OF.  But as I write this I realize that for me BS overall is just going to be forgettable in comparison to the aspirational but massively flawed OF.

This Expansions takes place during the game when Freeman arrives at Black Mesa you play as Barney Calhoune and its your first day on the job as a security guard at Black Mesa until when the Experiment Freeman causes goes wrong Barney falls down an elevator shaft and survives he must find and rescue a smart scientist named Rossenburg and his friends and fight in order to escape the facility. The Expansion is really fun you use the same weapons from Half Life but HEV suit and armor is replaced with Security Guard Armor and shows new levels inside Black Mesa that you couldn't explore as Gordon from Half Life. Overall I give it an 9/10 for playing another character during Half Life and the levels and dialogue.
